Detailed Description

template<class T>
class ImageClassifier< T >

ImageClassifier object, performs a Jenks-Caspall classification on generic binary image data.

The ImageClassifier object is responsible for performing the image classification. It makes use of the ImageClass object to store all class information, and the ModelMaker object to build the spatial modeler script.

Contruct an ImageClassifier object using an image file and a certain number of classes.

This constructor instantiates an ImageClassifier object loading the image referenced by filename, numClasses number of classes.

template<class T>
void ImageClassifier< T >::classify (  int  numClasses = 0  ) 
 

Perform the classification.

This function runs the classification algorithm on the current data values. If the user passes in a value for numClasses other than 0, he/she will override the number of generated classes that was specified in the constructor.

Parameters:
numClasses Number of classes to generate, overrides current value if not 0.
Exceptions:
GeneralException.

template<class T>
void ImageClassifier< T >::saveReportXML (  const char *  filename,
DataType  type
) 
 

Save results to an XML file.

This function saves your classification results to an XML file. If the file referenced by "filename" allready exists and is properly formatted, the classification results will be appended to the file, rather than writing a new file. This allows you to have classification data for multiple image layers (which are each stored in a separate file) in one XML file.

Parameters:
filename The XML output file.
type The DataType of the original image.
Exceptions:
GeneralException.

bool ImageClassifier< T >::valueExists (  T  val  )  [private]
 

Determine if a value exists.
